name: Zoe
title: the Aspect of Twilight
lore: As the embodiment of mischief, imagination, and change, Zoe acts as the cosmic messenger of Targon, heralding major events that reshape worlds. Her mere presence warps the arcane mathematics governing realities, sometimes causing cataclysms without conscious effort or malice. This perhaps explains the breezy nonchalance with which Zoe approaches her duties, giving her plenty of time to focus on playing games, tricking mortals, or otherwise amusing herself. An encounter with Zoe can be joyous and life affirming, but it is always more than it appears and often extremely dangerous.
blurb: As the embodiment of mischief, imagination, and change, Zoe acts as the cosmic messenger of Targon, heralding major events that reshape worlds. Her mere presence warps the arcane mathematics governing realities, sometimes causing cataclysms without...
allytips: Paddle Star deals more damage the further it has flown. Casting it behind yourself before redirecting can deal tons of damage.
Break Sleep with your biggest damage source, since enemies who are asleep take double damage.
Sleepy Trouble Bubble travels further over walls. Find a hiding spot to set up for a long distance kill.
enemytips: Zoe's Paddle Star deals more damage the further it has flown.
Zoe must return to her starting point after casting Portal Jump, making her vulnerable to a counterattack.
Sleepy Trouble Bubble travels further over walls. Stop Zoe from hiding in fog of war to prevent her from setting the spell up.

riot_spells.name: Paddle Star!
riot_spells.description: Zoe fires a missile that she can redirect in flight. Deals more damage the longer it flies in a straight line.
riot_spells.tooltip:
Fire a missile that deals increasing damage the further it travels -- {{ f1 }} (+{{ a1 }}) to {{ f2 }} (+{{ a2 }}) magic damage. Enemies near the first target hit take {{ e4 }}% damage.


Recast to redirect the missile to a new position near Zoe.

Paddle Star! deals damage based on a combination of Paddle Star's rank and Zoe's level.

riot_spells.name: Spell Thief
riot_spells.description: Zoe can pick up the remnants of enemy summoner spell and active item casts and cast them once herself. Whenever she casts a summoner spell, she gains 3 missiles that fire at the nearest target.
riot_spells.tooltip:
Enemy Summoner Spell and Active Item casts drop spell shards lasting 40 seconds. Some minions also drop a spell shard when Zoe kills them.

Active: Collecting a spell shard grants one cast of that spell.
____________________________________________

Passive: When Zoe casts a Summoner Spell or Spell Thief, she gains {{ e9 }}% movement speed for {{ e0 }} seconds and tosses up to 3 missiles at her attack target, dealing {{ e8 }} (+{{ a1 }}) magic damage total. Each missile can apply More Sparkles!

Movement speed bonus and missile damage improve with spell rank.

riot_spells.name: Sleepy Trouble Bubble
riot_spells.description: Causes the target to become drowsy, then fall asleep. The first source of damage that breaks the sleep is doubled, up to a cap.
riot_spells.tooltip:
Dropkick a bubble that deals {{ e1 }} (+{{ a1 }}) magic damage, lingering as a trap if it hits nothing. The bubble's range is extended when flying over a wall.

After a delay, the victim falls asleep for 2 seconds. Attacks and spell hits break sleep but deal double damage, up to {{ e6 }} (+{{ a2 }}) bonus true damage.

riot_spells.name: Portal Jump
riot_spells.description: Blink to a nearby position for 1 second. Then blink back.
riot_spells.tooltip:
Blink to a nearby position for 1 second. Then blink back.

Zoe may cast and attack, but not move, during this time. She can also see over walls.

riot_passive.name: More Sparkles!
riot_passive.description: Zoe's next basic attack after casting a spell deals bonus magic damage.

i1.name: More Sparkles!
i1.blurb: Zoe's next basic attack after casting a spell deals bonus magic damage.
i1.description: {{sbc|Innate:}} After casting an [[champion ability|ability]], '''Zoe's''' next [[basic attack]] within 5 seconds won't use a {{tip|projectile}} and deals {{pp|16;20;24;28;32;36;42;48;54;60;66;74;82;90 to 130|color=magic damage}} {{as|(+ 20% AP)}} {{tip|magic damage|{{as|'''bonus''' magic damage}}}}.

q1.name: Paddle Star
q1.blurb: Zoe fires a missile that she can redirect in flight, which deals more damage the longer it flies in a straight line.
q1.description: {{sbc|First Cast:}} '''Zoe''' shoots a ''star'' in the target direction that collides with the first enemy hit, dealing {{as|magic damage}} in a small area, reduced to 80% to enemies hit beyond the first. The ''total'' damage is increased by {{pp|7|type=distance traveled|key=%|0 to 150|800;950;1350;1650;1950;2250;2550}}.
q1.description2: If the ''star'' does not hit an enemy, it lingers at maximum range for 1 second.
q1.description3: {{sbc|Second Cast:}} While the ''star'' is out, '''Zoe''' can reactivate ''Paddle Star'' to redirect it to a new location near her, resetting its damage modifier on cast. The redirected ''star'' can travel beyond the new target location, continuing forward until it moves more than 800 units from '''Zoe'''.
q1.cooldown: {{tt|{{ap|8.5 to 6.5}}|Starts after the cast is complete.}}
q1.notes:
* At max rank and max level, the ability deals between 200 {{as|(+ 60% AP)}} and 500 {{as|(+ 150% AP)}} magic damage, based on distance.
* The secondary radius matches the initial maximum range of the ability, but '''Zoe''' can move any amount of distance away from the projectile before reactivating.

w1.name: Spell Thief
w1.blurb: Zoe can pick up the remnants of enemy summoner spell and active item casts and cast them once herself. Whenever she casts a summoner spell, she gains 3 missiles that fire at the nearest target.
w1.description: {{sbc|Passive - Spell Thief:}} Whenever enemy champions cast a {{ccib|Summoner spell icon.png|summoner spell}} or {{ccib|Active ability item icon.png|Active ability items|item active}}, they drop the corresponding ''{{as|{{ccib|Spell Thief Minimap.png||Spell Shard}}|armor}}'' onto the ground that grants {{tip|sight}} over a 100-radius area and remains for 40 seconds. Some enemy {{tip|minions}} spawn with random ''{{as|Spell Shards|armor}}'' that only drop to the ground for 20 seconds if killed by '''Zoe'''.
w1.description2: Collecting a ''{{as|Spell Shard|armor}}'' allows '''Zoe''' to activate ''Spell Thief'' within the next 60 seconds. She can replace her current ''Spell Thief'' active by moving directly onto another ''{{as|Spell Shard|armor}}''.
w1.description3: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Zoe''' mimics the active of the collected ''{{as|Spell Shard|armor}}''.
w1.description4: {{sbc|Passive - Wheeeee:}} Casting ''Spell Thief'' or one of her own summoner spells grants '''Zoe''' {{sti|ms|{{As|'''bonus''' movement speed}}}} for the next few seconds, and summons three bubbles that orbit her for the next 10 seconds. The bubbles autonomously hurl themselves at the nearest enemy in range, prioritizing her attack target, dealing {{as|magic damage}}.
w1.notes:
* Mimics the details of the mimicked active.
* Minions that can drop ''{{as|Spell Shards|armor}}'' are marked with a tied cosmic balloon that floats above them.
** Minions do not drop a shard for {{ii|Hextech Gunblade}} or {{si|Teleport}}.
* '''Zoe''' utilizes an attack-like animation whenever one of the bubbles hurls itself at an enemy, making it look as if she can attack while moving. 
* '''Zoe''' cannot steal [[Consumable item]]s, [[Trinket]]s, [[Item#Classification|component]] items, or items that create deployable or persistent effects. Some actives are excluded for balance purposes. The following list was last checked November 8th.<ref>[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=I4u0eOkzQHs Spell Thief list]</ref>:
{{Zoe Spell Thief list}}

e1.name: Sleepy Trouble Bubble
e1.blurb: Causes the target to become drowsy, then fall asleep. The first source of damage that breaks the sleep is doubled, up to a cap.
e1.description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Zoe''' kicks a ''bubble'' in the target direction that bursts on the first enemy hit, else forming a [[trap]] at maximum range for 5 seconds that arms after {{fd|0.8}} seconds. The ''bubble'' can only move through terrain once but may do so indefinitely, can only move up to 650 units once outside terrain, and will fall short if it would enter terrain again.
e1.description2: The ''bubble'' deals {{as|magic damage}} on contact with an enemy and renders them {{tip|drowsy}} for {{fd|1.4}} seconds, which gradually {{tip|slow|slows}} them, after which they fall {{tip|sleep|asleep}} for {{fd|2.25}} seconds.
e1.description3: The next [[dot|non-dot]] champion or turret damage taken by the {{tip|sleep|sleeping}} target deals {{tip|true damage|{{as|'''bonus''' true damage}}}} equal to the [[Damage modifier|post-mitigation]] damage dealt, capped at ''Sleepy Trouble Bubble's'' damage. The '''bonus''' damage is dealt before the triggering damage.
e1.notes:
* [[Spell shield]]s will fully block the ''bubble'' projectile but will not when it becomes a ''trap''. Stepping on it will only block the ''drowsy'' debuff, without blocking the damage. 
* Activating a spell shield while being ''drowsy'' will not block the ''falling asleep'' debuff.
* Removing the {{tip|Drowsy}} effect prevents the target from falling {{tip|sleep|asleep}}.
* If exceptionally close to terrain, the ball will pass through without detection and will still be able to pass through a second piece of terrain - although it sacrifices any range its already used going through the first piece.

r1.name: Portal Jump
r1.blurb: Blink to a nearby position for 1 second. Then blink back.
r1.description: {{sbc|Active:}} After a brief delay, '''Zoe''' dives into a portal that she opens beneath her, {{tip|blink|blinking}} to the target location.
r1.description2: '''Zoe''' remains able to attack and cast abilities during ''Portal Jump'', and can {{tip|sight|see}} over walls, but is unable to move. After 1 second, she blinks back to her cast location.
r1.notes:
* '''Zoe''' will always blink back to her original location, even if she is {{tip|immobilize|immobilized}} or killed.
*'''Zoe's''' movement speed is set to 0 during the duration of the portal, but she is not considered {{tip|root|rooted}}, which allows her to use movement spells and items such as {{si|Flash}} or {{ii|Hextech Protobelt-01}}.
* Upon reaching her destination, Zoe will either raspberry at the nearest enemy champion, or lick an ice cream cone when there are no enemy champions in sight.
